did.unittitle: Higham correspondence

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Letters addressed to Higham regarding fund raising for various churches in Great Britain and his donations to them.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Higham Correspondence is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Higham Correspondence. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, this has been noted in the box-and-folder list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses accessions of materials pertaining to C. D. Higham.

did.unittitle: Correspondence
Baillie, Sir Albert Victor, 1864-1955. ALS to [C. D. Higham], Deanery, Windsor
Bainbrigge, Philip Thomas, senior
ALS to Charles Higham, Gt. St. Helen's
ALS to C. D. Higham, Pembroke College, Oxford
ALS to C. D. Higham, Leicester
Barry, Alfred, Bp. Primate of Australia, 1826-1910. 2 ALS to C. D. Higham, King's College, London
Bayfield, Matthew Albert, 1852-1922. 4 ALS to C. D. Higham, [v.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thanks for book, his "liberal gift" to help a parish of colliers in the north, and apologizes for sending packet late.

did.unittitle: Billing, Robert Claudius, d. 1898. ALS to [C. D. Higham?], [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gives reasons for donating to his East London Church Fund.
